name: Jakub Wiszowaty
about: I'm a curious and fast-learning junior software developer with a strong background in chemistry. I am eager to join a team with a supportive environment to develop my skills further and use my excellent problem-solving skills to contribute to real-world projects. I have experience with working in teams and independently. In the past four months, I have explored PL/SQL, Java and testing. I'm currently undertaking the Java 17 Masterclass course on Udemy.

experience.title: Trainee Software Engineer
responsibilities: Completed two specialized trainings in Data Science and Software Development.

experience.title: Trainee Software Engineer
responsibilities: The boot camp involved high-intensity learning where I learned about the industry's best practices.
Practiced collaboration in paired programming throughout the boot camp and significantly improved interpersonal skills.

experience.title: English Tutor
responsibilities: Prepared over 600 hours of online lessons for Polish high school students.
Improved my students' pronunciation.
Helped them overcome a fear of speaking in a foreign language.

experience.title: Research Assistant
responsibilities: Organic synthesis of substituted amphetamines and analogues of cannabidiols.
Reversed and normal phase purification of organic compounds using Biotage.
Analytical methods used: NMR, LC-MS, HPLC.

experience.title: Research Project
responsibilities: Organic synthesis of analogues of barbituric acid.
Purification using manual column chromatography and recrystallisation.
Analytical methods used: LC-MS, HPLC, NMR (1H, 13C, 19F).

experience.title: Summer Intern
responsibilities: Organic synthesis of analogues of cannabidiols.

experience.title: Team Member
responsibilities: Worked efficiently with a team of 13 staff members in a busy restaurant environment.
Maintained clean working space and shared responsibilities of a waiter, kitchen porter, cashier.

volunteer_work.title: Vaccination Centre Volunteer
volunteer_work.organization: RVI Newcastle Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
responsibilities: 4-hour shift on Sundays for three months.
Welcomed and directed patients in the centre to the check-in desks and kept them company in the queue, distracting them from their fear of vaccination.
Organized a line for patients under 18 to maintain a good flow of patients and their parents, ensuring a comforting visit.

volunteer_work.title: Pharmacy Department Volunteer
volunteer_work.organization: RVI Newcastle Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
responsibilities: 4-hour shift on Sundays for three weeks.
Contacted COVID-19 patients with underlying conditions to confirm their details and dispatched their medication to their homes.

volunteer_work.title: Emergency Department Volunteer
volunteer_work.organization: RVI Newcastle Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
responsibilities: 4-hour night shift on Saturdays.
Conversed with patients and comforted them with available food and beverages.
Helped communicate between the nurses/doctors and patients, notifying personnel about anything that needed attention.
